_source.contentraw:
Corrupt Liberal DA Has Another Judgement Against Her After Being Found Guilty Of Over 100 Counts Of Misconduct... Guess Who Funded Her Election
100 Percent Fed Up ^ | Apr 21, 2022 | Adam Wilson
https://100percentfedup.com/corrupt-liberal-da-has-another-judgement-against-her-after-being-found-guilty-of-over-100-counts-of-misconduct-guess-who-funded-her-election/

The left-wing Circuit Attorney for St. Louis, Missouri played with fire and got burned while attempting a corrupt prosecution against ex-Missouri Governor and U.S Senate candidate Eric Greitens.

A former FOX News contributor attempted to obtain information relating to the prosecution, including the Circuit Attorney‚Äôs contacts and her office failed to respond to the request.

The attorney‚Äôs office attempted to appeal the judgment against her, which the judge struck down today.

Kimberly M. Gardner, the attorney in question has received financial backing from liberal billionaire George Soros. Soros was also one of the contacts she was attempting to hide from the records request.

The St. Louis Dispatch Reported‚Äì

The Missouri Court of Appeals at St. Louis on Tuesday upheld a judge‚Äôs ruling against the St. Louis Circuit Attorney‚Äôs Office for failing to respond to a lawsuit that alleged violations of the state‚Äôs open records law.

The appeals court‚Äôs unanimous ruling said Circuit Attorney Kimberly M. Gardner‚Äôs appeals had ‚Äúno merit.‚Äù She had challenged St. Louis Circuit Judge Christopher McGraugh‚Äôs ruling and $5,000 penalty for refusing to produce records and respond in time to a January 2020 lawsuit filed by conservative journalist John Solomon.

‚ÄúBased on this whole record, we hold the trial court did not err in finding (Gardner‚Äôs) failure to file a timely response to (Solomon‚Äôs) amended petition was not the result of an unexpected or unavoidable hindrance, accident, or mishap, but was instead the result of (Gardner‚Äôs) carelessness, inattention, and deliberate disregard,‚Äù the court said.

Solomon, a former Fox News contributor who runs the website Just the News, sought all of Gardner‚Äôs contacts with staff and other key players in the 2018 criminal investigations of then-Gov. Eric Greitens.

Those people include Missouri Times publisher Scott Faughn, Clayton lawyer Albert Watkins, billionaire mega-donor George Soros and former state Reps. Stacey Newman...

Prosecutors, What Are the Odds?
What if the Attorney General for the United States, 50 state Attorney Generals, and 1185 District Attorney Generals and all their Deputy Attorney Generals all decided to not prosecute those aiding and abetting illegal aliens?
What if they allowed a mayor to order the police to stand down in a riot?
What if they targeted patriots?
What if they targeted our President?
What if they didn't prosecute individuals, a single judge, a mayor or governor for changing voting laws without involving their legislature?
What if they allowed individuals to deny us a recount?
What if the Supreme Court of the United States of America turned their heads to voter fraud?
What if that picture of Chuck Schumer with an underage girl on Epstein Island goes unpunished?
What if Joe Biden bribing the Ukraine goes unpunished?
What if Hunter Biden selling military tech to the communist Chinese goes unpunished?
What if Hillary Clinton selling uranium to the Russians goes unpunished?
What if we went to war against Syria without a declaration of war and supported the rebels in slaughtering 600,000 people and making 6 million refugees and nobody cared?
What if we let these same people support the rebels in overthrowing Egypt and Libya? 
The same people that attacked our President, his lawyers, Flynn, Roger Stone, the same people that supported voter fraud, the same people that support pedophiles in classrooms, the people that traffic 10,000 young immigrants a year, all go unpunished by our inept or corrupt attorney generals.

There is an attorney general for every state.
Seven states do not popularly elect an attorney general. In Alaska, Hawaii, New Hampshire, New Jersey, and Wyoming, the attorney general is a gubernatorial appointee. The attorney general in Tennessee is appointed by the Tennessee Supreme Court for an eight-year term. In Maine, the attorney general is elected by the state Legislature for a two-year term.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_attorney_general

The District of Columbia and two U.S. territories, Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands, elect their attorneys general for a four-year term. 2014 marked the first year that the District of Columbia and Northern Mariana Islands held an election for the office. In American Samoa, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, the attorney general is appointed by the governor. In Puerto Rico, the attorney general is officially called the secretary of justice, but is commonly known as the Puerto Rico attorney general.

_source.content: Situation That Required A Lawyer For Estate Planning | Frederic GierschMany people feel that they can arrange their estates without the assistance of a lawyer. There are even websites where you may print off a will and alter it to match your requirements and wants, giving the impression that you don't need to involve anybody else (or even pay a lawyer).Some people even try to avoid hiring a lawyer after a loved one has died. They attempt to interpret the will and perform what is requested without spending any more money. They believe it should be easy enough that they do not need to engage a lawyer to assist them.It is usually good to consult with a lawyer when arranging your estate. You should also contact one if you handle the administration of a recently deceased person's estate.Even if you don't think you need one, double-checking is never a bad idea. Here are some best-case scenarios in which an estate planning lawyer should still be engaged.For more information, visit: https://medium.com/@fredericgiersch/eric-giersch-explains-five-best-case-scenarios-that-still-require-a-lawyer-for-estate-planning-bfd2e1c52fc7#fredericgiersch#attorney #lawyer #law #lawyers #attorneyatlaw #attorneys
_source.contentraw:
Situation That Required A Lawyer For Estate Planning | Frederic Giersch

Many people feel that they can arrange their estates without the assistance of a lawyer. There are even websites where you may print off a will and alter it to match your requirements and wants, giving the impression that you don't need to involve anybody else (or even pay a lawyer).

Some people even try to avoid hiring a lawyer after a loved one has died. They attempt to interpret the will and perform what is requested without spending any more money. They believe it should be easy enough that they do not need to engage a lawyer to assist them.

It is usually good to consult with a lawyer when arranging your estate. You should also contact one if you handle the administration of a recently deceased person's estate.

Even if you don't think you need one, double-checking is never a bad idea. Here are some best-case scenarios in which an estate planning lawyer should still be engaged.

For more information, visit: https://medium.com/@fredericgiersch/eric-giersch-explains-five-best-case-scenarios-that-still-require-a-lawyer-for-estate-planning-bfd2e1c52fc7

_source.content: It was the King of Virland ‚Äì0 he was angry then ‚ÄìThat rode to crush rebellionWith twenty thousand men.His enemies he scatteredAnd hanged on every side,Because their creed was rapine,Their cause was greed and pride.They searched for Outlaw Eric,They hunted everywhere ‚Äì(Most honest of the rebelsIf aught was honest there).King Hertzberg swore to hang him,But, when the day was done,They had not found the Outlaw,But found his little son.He had not seen his father,Nor knew where he had gone;And someone asked him, thoughtless,Which side himself was on,And straightway he made answer ‚ÄìThey found he answered true ‚Äì'My father is a rebel,And I'm a rebel too.'King Hertzberg, he dismounted,And kindly bent his head:'Now, why are you a rebel,My little man?' he said.The boy nor paused nor faltered,But stood like Eric's son,And answered Hertzberg simply ‚Äì'Because my father's one.'And then they promised all things,Dear to his heart, I ween ‚ÄìThey promised they would make himThe first page to the queen,With princesses for playmates ‚ÄìBut, nay, it would not do ‚Äì'My father is a rebel,And I'm a rebel too!'King Hertzberg sank beside himAnd rested on one knee.'I would my royal childrenAs loyal were!' said he.'Go, seek and tell your fatherThat he and his go free,And if his wrongs be realThen let him come to me.'And let him come with plain words,With plain words in daylight,And ride not with armed rebelsAnd outlaws in the night.And let him not misjudge me ‚ÄìFor to all that is untrue,And wherever Wrong's the ruler,I am a rebel too.
_source.contentraw:
It was the King of Virland ‚Äì
0 he was angry then ‚Äì
That rode to crush rebellion
With twenty thousand men.
His enemies he scattered
And hanged on every side,
Because their creed was rapine,
Their cause was greed and pride.

They searched for Outlaw Eric,
They hunted everywhere ‚Äì
(Most honest of the rebels
If aught was honest there).
King Hertzberg swore to hang him,
But, when the day was done,
They had not found the Outlaw,
But found his little son.

He had not seen his father,
Nor knew where he had gone;
And someone asked him, thoughtless,
Which side himself was on,
And straightway he made answer ‚Äì
They found he answered true ‚Äì
'My father is a rebel,
And I'm a rebel too.'

King Hertzberg, he dismounted,
And kindly bent his head:
'Now, why are you a rebel,
My little man?' he said.
The boy nor paused nor faltered,
But stood like Eric's son,
And answered Hertzberg simply ‚Äì
'Because my father's one.'

And then they promised all things,
Dear to his heart, I ween ‚Äì
They promised they would make him
The first page to the queen,
With princesses for playmates ‚Äì
But, nay, it would not do ‚Äì
'My father is a rebel,
And I'm a rebel too!'

King Hertzberg sank beside him
And rested on one knee.
'I would my royal children
As loyal were!' said he.
'Go, seek and tell your father
That he and his go free,
And if his wrongs be real
Then let him come to me.

'And let him come with plain words,
With plain words in daylight,
And ride not with armed rebels
And outlaws in the night.
And let him not misjudge me ‚Äì
For to all that is untrue,
And wherever Wrong's the ruler,
I am a rebel too.

(Things to think about...)

QTSR - A SECRET NATO BIOLOGICAL WEAPONS LABORATORY UNDERGROUND IN MARIUPOL.
CODENAME: PIT-404

"There are still about three thousand soldiers and fighters hidden in the basement of the two steel plants in Azovstal. The reconstruction presented by Escobar reports the presence of several military advisors from the Atlantic Alliance countries. The secret NATO facility is said to be under the command of U.S. Lieutenant General Roger L. Cloutier, who was arrested by DNR militias during an escape attempt by helicopter.

According to Escobar's reconstruction, the Pit-404 laboratory was a facility dedicated to chemical and biological weapons research. More than three hundred military advisors were trapped in the tunnels, officers from Germany, Canada, the United States, France, Italy, Poland, Turkey, Sweden, and Greece.

The siege of the Azovstal underground tunnels is linked to the dismissal of Eric Vido, the head of French military intelligence. General Vido was dismissed by President Macron after only seven months in office "for shortcomings in intelligence work during the Ukraine crisis." In recent days, a video was posted on social networks showing a green beret of the French Legion. The dramatic situation in the dungeons of Mariupol explains the diplomatic efforts of France and Germany to create humanitarian corridors for the exfiltration of foreign officers who should not be there.

Mariupol has become the epicenter of confrontation and is defended so vehemently because it has been the center of aggression in the Donbass for years and one of NATO's cornerstones in Ukraine. Under the pressure of the Russian army, barricaded in the tunnels, so there would be not only Ukrainian troops, but also NATO officers and advisers. "

Selon Odoxa, le pr√©sident Macron √©prouve de grandes difficult√©s √† courtiser les √©lecteurs qui se sont port√©s sur d'autres candidats au premier tour de l'√©lection, et n'a pas √©t√© en mesure d'attirer plus de 50 % des √©lecteurs d'aucun des candidats √©limin√©s au premier tour.

Pendant ce temps, Marine Le Pen devrait pouvoir compter sur environ 80 % des √©lecteurs qui ont vot√© pour l'√©crivain et expert conservateur Eric Zemmour.

https://t.co/4sevAHdho1

Le sondage affirme √©galement que le d√©bat de mercredi entre les deux candidats n'a rien fait pour aider l'un ou l'autre camp, Macron apparaissant comme antipathique pour 58 % des r√©pondants et 72 % le consid√©rant comme le "pr√©sident des riches."

Un autre sondage r√©alis√© apr√®s le d√©bat a montr√© que six Fran√ßais sur dix soutenaient la proposition de Le Pen d'interdire le voile islamique dans les espaces publics, une politique √† laquelle Macron s'est fermement oppos√©, arguant qu'une interdiction devrait √™tre donn√©e √† tous les symboles religieux.

Un chemin vers la victoire pour Le Pen pourrait se dessiner en raison du grand nombre d'√©lecteurs d√©clarant qu'ils s'abstiendront totalement de voter, le sondage Odoxa notant que le nombre de personnes refusant de voter, laissant leur carte de vote vide ou g√¢chant leur bulletin pourrait atteindre un nombre record.
